[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Be it resolved that the Medford School Committee express its sincere condolences to the family of Officer Luis Remigio.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Officer Remigio was the brother of Brooks School Librarian Natalie Pereira and uncle of Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Pereira's two children that attend Medford High School.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Be it resolved that the Medford School Committee express its sincere condolences to the family of Ian Volpe.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Volpe was a former elementary teacher at the Kennedy School and the wife of the late Larry Volpe, former director of Vocational School.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Be it resolved that the Medford School Committee express its sincere condolences to the family of Eleanor DeMos.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mrs. DeMos was the wife of James DeMos, former Director of Pupil Services, and the mother-in-law of Shannon DeMos, Assistant Principal of the Brooks School.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: If you could all please rise and have a moment of silence on behalf of these citizens.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We also have one other amendment to the requested reports.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Benedetto?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This motion for suspension of the rules.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those in favor?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those opposed?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we have one item.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Nelson would like to explain something about our upcoming committee of the whole meeting regarding the new MCAS.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Are there any questions?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to receive this paper and place it on file.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: You have a request?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: You have a pretty good idea right now of participation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there a follow up?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: One more.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: on file by Mr. Skerry, seconded by Mr. Benedetto.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those in favor?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Aye.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All those opposed?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion passes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I just want to make a general announcement.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: At 5 o'clock on Thursday, we're having a birthday party for this building, as well as dedicating several unique spaces within it.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So come on down.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It should be a fun night.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Birthday cake and food.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So come on down.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And there's a motion to adjourn this meeting.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Oh, no, no, no.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We're going into executive session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to go into executive session, seconded by Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: DiBenedetto.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Roll call vote, please, Mrs. Skerry.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Six in the affirmative.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: None in the negative.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: One absent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion passes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We'll now enter executive session.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you very much for participating tonight.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Can you hear me?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Much better.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you, Ward 6 and the Democratic Ward and City Committee, Griffin, for being here tonight.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you so much for offering us this forum in order to speak to you and the general public.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: My name is Stephanie Muccini-Burke, and I'm a candidate for re-election for the Office of Mayor for the City of Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I'm the proud daughter of Lee, who's in our audience, and my dad, George, and we grew up on First Street in Wellington.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: My husband, Brian, and I have three beautiful children.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We've been married 31 years, and all of our kids attended public schools and went on to college.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Medford has been a wonderful place to raise our family, and it's why we choose to stay here each and every day.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is our home.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: After graduating from Medford High School, I attended Suffolk University.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I commuted there every day and worked two jobs in order to put myself through.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Those years were filled with learning, and the greatest lesson was that there is no substitution for hard work.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: At Suffolk, I received a Bachelor of Science in Business with a major in Accounting.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: After graduating, I was hired at a Big 8 accounting firm.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It was then that I earned my CPA license.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I then went on to Bentley University evenings while working and obtained my master's in taxation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: When Brian and I began our family, I changed career paths and I started my own business right in Medford Square on Forest Street.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It was called Rycon Financial, named after my two boys at the time, and did I know I was going to have a little girl, I probably would have changed the name, but I didn't at that point.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And I learned especially what goes on in Medford Square at that time after spending 10 years on Forest Street.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It was while self-employed that I felt I had a need that I had to get involved with the City Council.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I participated in local government.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I thought it was very important.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And the people of Medford honored me by electing me to serve 15 long years.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we worked really, really hard during those 15 years.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This was followed by five years as the Director of Personnel and Budget for the City of Medford under Mayor McGlynn.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And then in 2015, I was elected by the people to be Medford's mayor, one of the proudest days of my life.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Anyone visiting our city these days would quickly know that it is an election year.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: You know what that means.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Candidates using buzzwords and slogans, asking for support of you, the voter.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We hear it from this one, vote for me and I'll do this, or vote for me and I'll do that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So I am sure that you will not mind if I spare you the slogans and buzzwords because you deserve more than that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: You deserve a clear description of my accomplishments as mayor and my hopes for the next two years.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: After all, each of you wants the same thing that I want.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We want a Medford that can be the greatest it can be.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So when I say to you that I will be accountable, it's not a slogan.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is my acknowledgment that the work of government is never done alone.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is never the work of one person.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We live in a democracy and we work in collaboration with each other, and that is why I call each of you a partner in progress.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As I stated, I'm a certified public accountant.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: My professional experience has brought me a deep understanding of the value of managing assets.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is second nature to me.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And simply put, a well-managed city is one where the resources and assets of the city are identified, needs are assessed, and needs are fulfilled.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As we all know, this requires funding.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: My administration has and will continue to be a responsible steward of our taxpayers' hard-earned dollars.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We will continue to aggressively pursue grant funding to leverage our dollars.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Medford's high quality bond rating is no accident.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's the result of careful planning and a prudent expenditure of municipal funds to projects that better our city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Just today, we were listed as a top 10 list of most successful cities by Zipia.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We're quite proud of that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: My administration has also been accountable where the rubber meets the road, literally through the Complete Streets Initiative, which we brought into the city of Medford within three months of me being sworn into office.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have moved forward to repave and fix major roads throughout every section of the city, which will make it safer for pedestrians, bicyclists, and vehicles.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Our infrastructure needs are continually being addressed through the efforts of our Department of Public Works.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I am proud of tackling the issues of the need of a new police station head-on.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: For years, the rundown condition of the police department headquarters has been known.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: For years, this one condition was not adequately addressed.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: But I did not choose to look in the rearview mirror and ask why.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Rather, I have chosen to look forward.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Because the starting point of all success is action, not blame.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So my administration initiated the process to build a new state-of-the-art police station.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We've been meeting weekly now for over three months.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's a team that's comprised of our police chief, our city engineer, our environmentalist, as well as members of the police squad from all levels.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: men, female, that have been visiting police stations around our state and around our area to find out what's the best and what's the worst.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: What do we like?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: What do we want our station to have so that we do it right once, not have to go back and make changes two years down the road because it's the police headquarters that simply doesn't work.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Our fine law enforcement personnel deserve nothing less, as they serve the safety needs of our residents every hour of every day of every night.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: In the world in which we live, safety can never be taken for granted.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The needs of our public safety employees are many, and they must continually be addressed.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have done just that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: In year one of our five-year capital plan, the city has purchased 12 new police cruisers, breathing apparatus and turnout gear for our firefighters, new trucks and equipment for our DPW employees.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: However, public safety and public health is more than new equipment.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is the converging of all departments and levels of government to come together to fight an epidemic.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Of course, I'm speaking of the opioid crisis.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Every Medford family stands shoulder to shoulder with each other in the fight against this reality.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: When one of our families suffers, we all suffer.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So to assist in this fight and augment the public services already in place, I did hire a full-time recovery coach.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: For the first time, there's someone who has a specific purpose to work within our community, along with various agencies.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Marion Ryan, our district attorney, has monthly forums up at the Lawrence Memorial Hospital, where she brings together public health officials, City of Medford employees, police, fire from a multitude of communities to talk about this issue and to determine best practices.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This is already being done today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This is a disease that is so decimating to so many, especially our young people.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Sometimes the quality of life in our city can oftentimes be measured by the spaces that we gather as a community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This truth has not been lost on me.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It started with the rehabilitation of this beautiful building that we gather in today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Celebrating its 80th birthday, I might tell you, WPA project, and we're very proud, and there's a birthday party next Thursday evening, so come on down.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Also, we've been partnering with the Metropolitan Area Planning Council and with the input of residents and business owners.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We've engaged in a collaborative effort to plan for the revitalization of Medford Square.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This plan will not be put on a shelf.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This plan will be implemented.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I guarantee it.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And this has resulted in a goal of a mixed-use zone to live, work, and play, a plan for bicycle accessibility, safer streetscapes, connectivity of our pathways, and refocusing on our jewel, the mighty Mystic River.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: In addition, work has begun on the Riverside Plaza project.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This is an effort to transform a portion of Medford Square into a multi-use space to allow residents to engage in passive recreation or simply enjoy a community event.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Sense of community and quality of life go hand in hand.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We need these community spaces in order to do that.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Investment in a city also means to put its resources to their optimal use.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have done just that with the hidden gem, the Chevalier Theater.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: By hiring a professional management company, Bill Blumenreich presents of the Wilbur Theater, to promote the Chevalier and to serve not only as a catalyst for arts and culture, but also as well as economic development in our Medford Square.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This long overdue effort will create jobs, opportunities for our current and future small businesses, and provide an exciting new venue for first class entertainment in Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It is my hope that these efforts will not simply transform brick and mortar, but have an impact on the enjoyment of life for all of the residents of this city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I am equally proud to shape the creation of a new full-time recreation department.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This need has gone unaddressed in our community, and now we will have a department that will serve the recreational needs of Medford residents of all ages, young to old.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And when I hear the people say that our students are our future, I say that is an understatement.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I say that they are our potential and that we need to serve that potential now.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I am most proud of the work undertaken in support, supporting our expanded educational opportunities in our public schools.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Example of these new programs at Medford High include environmental studies, engineering, robotics, and a host of AP classes, a new media center that we're having a get together on this coming Sunday, as well as a brand new culinary arts restaurant, Bistro 489, that will be opening in November.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: With these uplifting programs, our talented teachers, and most importantly, supportive parents, Medford's future has never looked brighter.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Each of these efforts is aimed at one goal, to make our city a vibrant community where everyone, young to senior, in the richness of our diversity, can fulfill their definition of neighborhood, their hopes for their children and family, in a safe, fully inclusive, participatory, and democratic fashion.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We are a welcoming city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Being mayor is more than offering a slogan or a buzzword.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's living up to the promise to serve every single day.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Whether it be arts and culture, constituent service, or spending time with your children at school, I more than enjoy serving Medford as its mayor.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's a hard job, but one that I love, because every day brings new opportunity to work in collaboration with the fine people of our city, young to senior again, to implement the Medford of tomorrow.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: My education, experience, knowledge of government, and deep commitment to this city is demonstrated daily.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I am very proud of our first term accomplishments, but there is more work to be done.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Please allow me the opportunity and the honor of serving you as your mayor.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I humbly request that you vote for me.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Cast your vote on November 7th for Stephanie Muccini-Burke.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Please, let's continue to be partners in progress.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you and God bless.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's called the Cotton Swab Challenge, and I hereby challenge Mayor Curtatone of Somerville, Mayor Dolan of Melrose, and Mayor Christensen of Malden.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Take the challenge, make the pledge, come on, make it happen.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Together we can save a life, together we can be a match.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Present.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Six present, one absent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: All please rise and salute our flag.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And while you're all standing, if you could just remain standing so we can take a moment of silence for all the victims of the horrific event that happened in Las Vegas, as well as those that were injured.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Report on Community Preservation Act.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have members of the committee, the CPC committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As you may realize, a year and a half ago, the citizens of Medford voted to adopt the CPA Act, which allows for monies to be put in a trust fund and spent for certain purposes, affordable housing, open space, and historic preservation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we have with us two members tonight that would like to explain it so that the public can become more aware of this program.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have Joan Sear a member and Roberta Cameron is the chairperson of the committee.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I remember so many times seeing you gathering signatures to make sure that this would happen.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I would love to see that here.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We already have oil and grass.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: are there any other recommendations they have been meeting with a lot of boards and commissions they've met with myself a lot of the department heads at City Hall

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Lauren DiLorenzo with OCD about the open space plan.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This committee has worked so diligently and put in so many hours so that they really listen to the community.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's almost like participatory budgeting to a degree where this is driven by the citizens as opposed to us up here driving it down.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So that's what's unique about this.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's really coming from people.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes, thank you.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And then they make recommendations to the city council.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Very good.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you very much for the presentation and hopefully we'll participate in the upcoming forums.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Is there a motion to receive and place this report on file?

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Yes.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: On the motion, seconded by Ms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you very much ladies.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Report on second annual health, wellness, and fitness fair.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mr. Superintendent.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: How appropriate at this time that I'm going to take an Advil.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As you may realize, a year and a half ago, the citizens of Medford voted to adopt the CPA Act, which allows for monies to be put in a trust fund and spent for certain purposes, affordable housing, open space, and historic preservation.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we have with us two members tonight that would like to explain it so that the public can become more aware of this program.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Motion to adjourn.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Thank you everybody for coming here today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We are so elated and excited to be welcoming Bill Blumenreich to this beautiful theater.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This really is a proud day for the city of Medford and just a little history of this building.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It was built in 1939.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: It's named for the remarkable World War I veteran.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Godfrey Chevalier, so we know that that name stands proudly and represents all of us as Americans.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: This theater has hosted John F. Kennedy, Frank Sinatra, and Leroy, so we have some high expectations for this.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We're so very excited to be partnering with you to allow this theater to live up to its expectations, to have a grand flagship of Medford Square, and a critical component and a catalyst for the Medford Square Revitalization.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we are very, very thrilled to have them on the board.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I need to acknowledge some of the members of the committee that worked on this process.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: As we all know, we did the second RFP back last spring.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And we put together a team, a highly qualified team, to make sure that this was a positive experience and a positive result in the end.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Leading it off is Mark Rumley, our city solicitor.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: commission members that worked very hard each and every step of the way to make sure that this RFP was what we needed and what we wanted for the city of Medford.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: With us today is John Costas, the chair of the Chivalry Commission.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Mike Oliver is not present today, but he also worked very hard on this.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He would have been the third commission member on this committee that we put together.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We're also lucky to have in attendance today City Council President Rick Caraviello,

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: spent on this RFP.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And Paul Solano, I'm a commission member as well, so thank you Paul.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Countless hours were spent on this RFP and I know by the faces in this room that many of you haven't heard those countless hours right down to pretty much this morning.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we're just really thrilled that we were able to pull it all together.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And my deepest thanks go out for a job well done by all involved.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I further want to thank the endless devotion of past members of the Chevalier Commission that began in 1981, and friends of the Chevalier, especially Geraldine Brandy, who put her heart and soul into this building, and she made it a beautiful gem for this city.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And I know she's looking down on us, too, so very, very proudly today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So a thank you to our friend Geraldine upstairs.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have a few of the friends here today.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: We have Nate Mockerbrack, we have Cindy Watson, and we also have Russ that also worked very hard to make sure that this place stayed up.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: I think it was blood, sweat, and tears for a lot of you, and we've seen it each and every day, and you've never let down.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So thank you all for the hard work that you've done over the course of the tenure of this beautiful building.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So now, the highlights of the agreement.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: The contract is comprised of four five-year terms.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Bill Bloomberg will furnish to the City of Medford $1 for each ticket sold that will go into a restoration fund for the Chevalier Theatre.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So the money that we've taken as a city is going to be reused again and again and again to make enhancements to this building.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Hiring Medford residents is a priority, and up to 15 performances per year will be free for the City of Medford to have.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So those are really great kudos, and thank you for allowing us to work back into the agreement that's at hand today, and we'll be signing shortly.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And also, we all know that we have the Boys and Girls Clubs just below us.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: They will continue to have a home.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we are very proud that we were able to work through this agreement, continue to be able to allow the services that the Boys and Girls Club offer to our community, and for children in need.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we're just really thrilled that we were able to make this whole thing happen and blend it and work in harmony.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So we're really thrilled.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: Now, I would like to just welcome Joan Costa up to say a few words on behalf of the commission.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: has been out in the community over the past several months.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So he's taken, he met with our friends group, so they could get to know them and their philosophy for the theater.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: He's met with business owners, he met with Square.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: So he's hit the ground running already.

[Stephanie Muccini Burke]: And I think at this point, we really need to find these contracts, and we can make
